author: Simon Difford
description: It's a Daiquiri but with monastic Bénédictine and less than holy absinthe influences – perhaps it's the saffron in the Bénédictine, perhaps it's the star anise in the absinthe, but the result is truly a spiritual experience. It's simply divine.
name: Saint-Marc Daiquiri
recipeIngredient: 60 ml White (charcoal-filtered) 1-4 year old light rum
7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°brix)
10 ml Chilled water (omit if wet ice)

recipeInstructions.text: SHAKE all ingredients with ice and fine strain into chilled glass
